message.content: This question tests basic knowledge about the use of electricity and lighting. When the electricity goes out, one can still read at night by using an item made from a petroleum product with a cord sticking out the top. This refers to a lamp, which can be plugged into a power source and provide illumination. Option (A) is incorrect because a pizza cannot provide light for reading. Option (B) is unrelated to lighting and reading. Option (D) is also unrelated to lighting and reading.

Option (C) describes an item made from a petroleum product (likely a flashlight) with a cord sticking out the top, which implies that it is a battery-powered light source. Options (A), (B), and (D) are unrelated items that do not provide any information about how John was able to read at night without electricity.
